Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery bird bowl; interior glazed with added white-red-white stripe; exterior: part of bird with hatched body to right; three lines below; top of rim glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Illustrated in CVA Oxford 2, II D, pl. I.13. See also J. N. Coldstream, Greek Geometric Pottery (London 1968), p. 301, no 35. He dates the fragment from Naukratis to c. 650-615 BC.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 255, no. 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IId pl. 1, 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.062)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
